reviews.title: excellent
reviews.text: Me and My Wife were booked into the daydream island resort as part of our along the barrier reef tour and we thought it was wonderful !! if you get chance to do the island tour to hamilton & whitehaven beach just do it especially whitehaven it was like another world (to me anyway)

I stayed on Daydream Island for 5 nights in November 2006. The resort was pretty full and there were lots of kids but it didn't seem like there were any special facilities or programs for them. I was there by myself after a business trip so I was mainly looking for relaxation. The day spa is really wonderful- clean, beautiful and lots of things to choose. I had two treatments and both were fantastic- I would have booked more but many of the times were already taken with advance bookings. Like other reviews, I found the food to be poor quality (except at Mermaids) and the restaurant system to be bizarre and the lack of room service to be disappointing. Overall, I found the staff to be highly unprofessional and not friendly. On two occassions, I witnessed staff arguing with each other in front of guests and most of the time the staff would walk past me without saying hello. The room was ok though a bit less than what I would expect of 4-star (as the resort advertises). I feel like it was a lot of money for what it was in the end. I am not sure if I would go back to Daydream Island although the Whitsundays are beautiful.
reviews.title: Hospitality lacking

reviews.text: For a resort that promotes itself as family friendly island we were quite suprised by the lack of thought/care in providing for this clientele. Whilst we enjoyed the suroundings and generally had a good time, we wouldn't go back.
reviews.title: Kid friendly?? Not on your nelly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole the food is terrible. We were told that as the island wasn't at capacity, the outlets were on restricted hours - this meant that after 8.30pm the chance of getting anything at all to eat was slim to none - even on the nights when the island puts on free movies until 10pm.
reviews.title: Relaxing, affordable & comfortable - had a great Daydream holiday

likes.liked: — Spacious with lovely views & surroundings (nice tropical feel to it), with a choice of total relaxation/pampering or varied activities
likes.disliked: — Quite a small island - any more than a few days may grow boring for some unless you do tours & activities at extra costs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With no room service or real takeaway options, it meant that this mum and dad with two children under 3 years ended up eating chocolate from the mini bar for dinner one night as there was literally no other option!!
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

likes.disliked: — All of the children on the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did quite a bit of research before settling upon Daydream - the reviews on this site about daydream and the other islands seem to be quite mixed, but this one had a good average overall and it had most of the things that we wanted.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Daydream

likes.liked: — Lots of space - separate bed and lounge rooms! Spa, double shower
likes.disliked: — Palm Trees blocking view over water to North Molle- we were right on the water too...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally people are the makers of their own experiences, good or bad - and most people here who had negative experiences have no one to blame but themselves. Holidays require planning...some people seem to think the world should revolve around them...
reviews.title: Great for a short stay

reviews.text: Anyway - we had a great time. We were on our honeymoon and stayed for 5 nights which was a good time to relax and also to get around and see and do everything on the island. First two days the weather was perfect, after that it was a bit windy/wet/overcast but not so much so that you could not do stuff. Anything longer might have got a bit boring...
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever!

likes.liked: — Tropical atmosphere & access to varied activities

reviews.text: We stayed in the honeymooners suite up the end of the island - originally wanted a daydreamer suite but these were all booked out. Honeymooners suite was great - really big, lots of room, spa, double shower, however there are palm trees almost right outside the balcony that block 90% of the view which was quite disappointing. That was really the only downside about our experience. (to book the honeymooners suite you need to call up and request it - it's not advertised anywhere).
reviews.title: Needs some work and Staff training

reviews.text: We found the food options were great. Not cheap but what do you expect on an island. The complimentary breakfasts each morning were really good - we only had to wait for 15mins one morning, and were able to sit in the quiet room. There is always atleast two options for dinner everynight (Mermaids and Fishbowl Tavern) and these are fairly different to each other, and the other nights Waterfalls is open - so there is enough variety and we found the quality of the food to be excellent.
reviews.title: excellent, peaceful

reviews.text: I have just returned from a Wedding at Daydream for some very close friends. They are both in the Hospitality service and I just knew that the wedding would be beautiful. I had read the reviews on this website about daydream and how terrible it was, but I though "Hey, If my friends picked it and they work for great hotels, well then it can't be that bad" BOY WAS I WRONG. The location and rooms are beautiful. However, that is where it ends..... the Staff don't want to help any more than they have to and the management don't care about anything but themselves.
reviews.title: Staff & Management Don't Care About Guests
Couldn't wait to leave
reviews.text: On numerous occasions we had problems with dinner arrangements (there were approx. 60 people for the wedding who stayed 4 nights. But they had known about the wedding for 12mths) We were told that they could not cater for us or that we just had to have pizza and salad. Not what you want for dinner the night before your wedding.

Then at the wedding (which might I say was beautiful) a number of older people (26 - 40) were told that they had been "Cut Off" from the bar because they were intoxicated. Now, this was the tamest wedding I had ever been to, all everyone was doing was dancing or sitting at the tables drinking, no glasses broken, no falling over nothing. I think they cut people off so that people couldn't drink as much on the beverage packages.
reviews.title: Don't believe the hype
Nice but....
reviews.text: Overall, the wedding location and the settings were beautiful but the staff, and they attitude in general of staff and management were discusting!!!!! I would never ever ever go back. The only good part of the holiday apart from the wedding was the "day Spa" which was beautiful and the only place I could find nice staff.
